rename.from: Default error message for ShouldBeEqual barely misses IntelliJ diff detection
rename.to: Remove space in default error message for ShouldBeEqual to help IntelliJ diff detection

body:
We did that to get values aligned but I guess we can remove that space for intellij idea
```
expected:
but was :
```
@rpeng could we do that instead?:
```
expected:
 but was:
```
@scordio did you have that issue? can you try that second proposal to see if it renders properly?

Just tried it out with the second proposal (leading space) and it works in IntelliJ! For reference, the detectable patterns are here https://github.com/17712484466/intellij-community/blob/master/plugins/testng/src/com/theoryinpractice/testng/model/TestProxy.java#L48

thanks @rpeng! let's do that then.
Do you want to contribute it?
Will do! I'll get a pull request ready shortly

issue.title: Update ShouldBeEqual assertion message

repository.name: assertj-core
repository.description: AssertJ is a library providing easy to use rich typed assertions

issue.body:
Move the trailing space after "was" to a leading space before "but" so that IntellIJ's diff regexes can pick it up

#### Check List:
* Fixes #2199
* Unit tests : YES 
* Javadoc with a code example (on API only) : NA
* PR meets the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/assertj/assertj-core/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

Following the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/assertj/assertj-core/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) will make it easier for us to review and accept your PR.

issue.title: Update ShouldBeEqual assertion message

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
Move the trailing space after "was" to a leading space before "but" so that IntellIJ's diff regexes can pick it up

#### Check List:
* Fixes #2199 (ignore if not applicable)
* Unit tests : YES
* Javadoc with a code example (on API only) : NA
* PR meets the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/assertj/assertj-core/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

body:
Just made a pull https://github.com/assertj/assertj-core/pull/2200

Sorry about the noise above, I accidentally made a pull against my own fork...
To my knowledge when using the AssertionFailure from opentest4j IntelliJ will get the values from the exception itself, not looking into the string output.

Ah I did not know that, thanks for the insight. I wonder if this may be build-system dependent then. For example, when I run the test in IntelliJ, if it has to rely on capturing the output from an external tool (e.g. bazel?) instead of running it directly, it might have to resort to text matching to detect the expected vs. actual.
@rpeng not sure if it's possible, but it would be great to have a minimal example to play with it and understand the issue a bit better.
